chapter.title: Project Summary
chapter.para: The Project Summary page is the entry point of a CodeX hosted project. And, for any project, it is the only page you need to know about. From this page both ordinary registered users and project members/administrators can access all project resources and services. Unlike the Project Administration page (see ), the Project Summary page is public and can be visited by any CodeX user including anonymous ones. In some sense the Project Summary page displays the public face of a project.

section.title: Accessing a Project Summary Page
section.para: For project members, accessing the Project Summary page of one of their projects is pretty easy: go to your Personal Page and click on the appropriate project name.
For registered users there are several ways by which you can access the Project Summary page of a CodeX hosted project:

step.para: You can use the search box and look for a project name that you know of
You can explore the Software Map if you know where the project is
You can click on the Project name if it appears on the CodeX Site statistics on the right hand side of the CodeX home page
And finally you can type the Web URL to access the project page. All projects can be accessed at:

section.para: If your are thinking of visiting the Project Summary of a project on a regular basis we strongly advise you to bookmark it in your Personal Page the first time you access the page by using the "Bookmark This Page" link in the CodeX Main Menu. (see )

tip.title: The Project Summary Page is not the Project Home Page!
tip.para: The Project Home Page is not the same as the Project Summary Page. The Project Summary Page is an overview of all the software related activities and deliverables but it is not a substitute for a real Web Site where you describe what the project is about, related links and resources, etc. CodeX also offers a Web Site to each project. The "Home Page" item in the Project Main Menu is precisely a pointer to this Web Site (see for more information on your Project Web Site and how to use it).

section.title: Project Summary Page Content
section.para: A sample Project Summary page is available in . The page is split in several areas:

listitem.para: Project Main Menu: is at the top of the page right below the Project name. The Project Main Menu is a recap of all the services available for a given project. As you browse the various services and resources of a given project this menu will always be visible.

Short Description and Categorization: already described before. Next to the short description is a pointer to a longer description and to additional information provided by the creator of the project.

Project members and Administrators: are listed in the upper right corner of the page. A click on a name will direct you to the user page where you can learn more about the CodeX user and send him/her an e-mail.

Latest File Release: show the list of most recent packages available for download along with their revision. A Release Notes icon () allows you to see the latest changes and developers comments associated with this revision. Then comes the monitor icon (). Selecting this icon will cause this package to be monitored for you. Anytime the project development team posts a new release, you will be automatically notified via e-mail. All monitored File Releases are listed in your Personal Page and can be cancelled from this page.

Public Areas: this is an iconic list of all available services for this project along with some information next to it. Click on any of this item to access a service. The role of this area is pretty much equivalent to the Project Main Menu at the top of the screen except that it shows additional information about each of the service (e.g. total number of open bugs, tasks, ...)
Latest News: the last 10 pieces of news posted by the project members. Some of this news might also be visible on the CodeX front page if the CodeX Team decided that it was worth a site announcement.
